abstract: NetSuite, the business software company controlled by the founder of Oracle, Larry Ellison, filed Monday with regulators to hold an initial public offering. The stock sale will use the auction-style process that Google employed in its closely watched offering three years ago.
lead_paragraph: NetSuite, the business software company controlled by the founder of Oracle, Larry Ellison, filed Monday with regulators to hold an initial public offering. The stock sale will use the auction-style process that Google employed in its closely watched offering three years ago.

headline.main: Ellison’s ‘Other Company’ Prepares for an I.P.O.

abstract: What seemed like a petty dust up between SAP and Oracle may turn out to be a bigger fight now that the Justice Department is getting involved.
snippet: What seemed like a petty dust up between SAP and Oracle may turn out to be a bigger fight now that the Justice Department is getting involved.
lead_paragraph: When Oracle sued SAP in March, claiming the big German software maker was guilty of “corporate theft on a grand scale,” it seemed mainly an amusing entertainment in the staid halls of enterprise software.

headline.main: Oracle Suit: More than a Stunt?
